item.title: design review
item.goal: move full di-tau analysis to CMG
item.note:
Need to: - set up a test bench with real events - implement Cut Flow, Counters, Averages... - organize the code in packages (?)
X- each analyzer is a producer (event is passed) optional: reimplement setattr to protect overwriting, maybe add a put function (is the analyzer able to break the sequence?)
X- at the end: EventSorter an analyzer which handles the regions and gives (flags?) the event to the correct region.
X- even further (or within EventSorter) : histogrammers one histogrammer per possible region An histogrammer is a special version of the Analyzer.
List of analyzers :
X TauMu (and lepton veto) - select and produces _one_ diobject (does TauMu inherits from DiObject? also a base for DiMu, DiE, EMu) X Jets - select jets, clean them up from di-objects - produces VBF event - produces jets - produces cleanJets X EventSorter - Region IDs (a list?)
X Histograms
(do I really want to use inheritance? what about composition?) (are they used in EventSorter? Are they separated?)
Composition, used in the event sorter
PhysicsObject o DiObject o Lepton o Tau o Mu o Jet Vertex
Counters?
Averages?
CutFlow?

item.title: appeler maif - valeur totale + protection cambriolage
Fwd: check Physics Performance and DataSet (PPD) organization in 2012
item.note:
Begin forwarded message:
> From: Lucia Silvestris <lucia.silvestris@cern.ch> > Date: December 12, 2011 4:15:42 PM GMT+01:00 > To: cms-physics-coordination <cms-physics-coordination@cern.ch>, cms-mgt-dpg <cms-mgt-dpg@cern.ch>, <cms-ppd-conveners@cern.ch> > Subject: Physics Performance and DataSet (PPD) organization in 2012 > > Dear All, > > starting from January 1st, 2012, a new coordination area named Physics > Performance and Dataset (PPD) has been created inside the > CMS management. The PPD coordination area has been endorsed by the > Collaboration Board on 15th Sep, 2011 with the following mandate: > https://indico.cern.ch/getFile.py/access?contribId=6&resId=0&materialId=0&confId=151221. > > PPD coordinator is Lucia Silvestris (INFN-Bari). In a nutshell, PPD > coordination has been proposed to: > > * raise profile of key areas and address physics needs in: > > * Generators, simulation, reconstruction, code performance for > physics. > * Validation of generators, Trigger, MC and Data. > * Alignment and calibration. > * Definition/certification of collision datasets for physics. > > * includes AlCa, DB and DQM groups > * includes new Global Event Description (GED) team > o e.g. for maintenance of, and improvements to, particle flow > > * Physics Validation of upgrade software. > > PPD coordinator deputies and conveners have been endorsed by the > Collaboration Board on 2nd Dec, 2011: > https://indico.cern.ch/getFile.py/access?contribId=15&sessionId=3&resId=0&materialId=slides&confId=162333. > > PPD coordinator deputies are Patrizia Azzi (INFN-Padova)& Gianluca > Cerminara (CERN). > > Physics Data/MC Validation conveners are Gaelle Boudoul (IPNL -Lyon), > Danilo Piparo (CERN) and Jean-Roch Vlimant (UCSB) > > * Gaelle will focus on upgrade activities while Danilo and Jean-Roch > will cover current data taking issues. > > AlCaDB conveners are Marco De Mattia (Purdue University), Andreas > Pfeiffer (CERN) and Chiara Rovelli (INFN- Roma1) > > * Chiara and Marco will focus on AlCa while Andreas will focus on DB > matters > > DQM/Data Certification: Suchandra Dutta( Saha, Kolkata), Kaori Maeshima > (FNAL), Marco Rovere (CERN) > > PPD will convene the joint PVT and Physics Operations meeting and it > will be the forum for DPG, POG, PAG, Trigger, > Computing and Offline involvement in data taking. It is expected that > PPD group will facilitate vertical integration from the PAGs to POGs to > DPGs. > The PAGs would take an active part in driving the needs and would be > expected to help to provide resources to fulfill physics performance goals. > > best regards > Lucia >

item.title: Implement type 1 corrections for CMG objects
item.note:
Begin forwarded message:
> From: Kenichi Hatakeyama <kenichi.hatakeyama@cern.ch> > Date: October 28, 2011 3:14:05 AM GMT+02:00 > To: <hn-cms-met@cern.ch> > Subject: MET Type-I update > > > *** Discussion title: JetMET: Missing ET > > Dear MET enthusiasts, > > Many thanks to Christian Veelken, Florent Lacroix, and others, the > type-I MET code > was updated recently. > > A few updates include: > [1] There is a protection against very high jet energy corrections at > high eta (|eta|>4.7). > See e.g. Florent Lacroix - Sep 29 - MET meeting - page-8 > https://indico.cern.ch/contributionDisplay.py?contribId=5&confId=153360 > > [2] The type-1 jet correction is based on L1+L2+L3 -L1 instead of L2+L3 > only, so that the > jet L2+L3 corrections are not applied to the pileup energies within > jets. > See e.g. Florent Lacroix - Oct 20 - JME Pileup mini-workshop - > page-3-5 > http://indico.cern.ch/contributionDisplay.py?contribId=8&confId=156570 > > [3] For the PAT workflow, the jet smearing can be applied in order to > take into account > the data-MC differences in jet energy resolution. > See e.g. Christian Veelken - Oct 27 - MET meeting - page-8 > https://indico.cern.ch/contributionDisplay.py?contribId=5&confId=159994 > > The workbook is updated accordingly. > https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/CMSPublic/WorkBookMetAnalysis#HeadingFive > > Please let us know if you have any question. > > Regards, > Artur, Sarah, and Ken for all the MET developers/contributors > > [ MIME part of type text/html without a name stripped ] > > ------------------------------------------------------------- > Visit this CMS message (to reply or unsubscribe) at: > https://hypernews.cern.ch/HyperNews/CMS/get/met/187.html

item.title: V2_4_0_1 release
item.note:
Current: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Test Release based on: CMSSW_4_2_8 Base Release in: /afs/cern.ch/cms/slc5_amd64_gcc434/cms/cmssw/CMSSW_4_2_8 Your Test release in: /afs/cern.ch/user/c/cmgtools/scratch0/ProductionSoftware/V2_4_0/CMGTools/CMSSW_4_2_8 --- Tag --- -------- Package --------
O - cbern_h2tautauvars_31Oct11 AnalysisDataFormats/CMGTools
D - enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 CMGTools/Common
A file was on the head, but no difference with respect to this tag. CMGTools/Common/python/eventContent/trigger_cff.py So updating to this tag.
[cmgtools@lxplus413:3] Common >cvs -q diff -r enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 cvs server: cannot open /afs/cern.ch/user/c/cmgtools/.cvsignore: Permission denied ? python/PAT/.__afs163E ? python/PAT/.__afsE0E1 Index: python/eventCleaning/trackingFailureFilter_cfi.py =================================================================== RCS file: /cvs/CMSSW/UserCode/CMG/CMGTools/Common/python/eventCleaning/trackingFailureFilter_cfi.py,v retrieving revision 1.1 retrieving revision 1.2 diff -r1.1 -r1.2 7c7 < JetSource = cms.InputTag('ak5PFJets'), --- > JetSource = cms.InputTag('pfJetsAK5'), Index: python/eventContent/particleFlow_cff.py =================================================================== RCS file: /cvs/CMSSW/UserCode/CMG/CMGTools/Common/python/eventContent/particleFlow_cff.py,v retrieving revision 1.23 retrieving revision 1.24 diff -r1.23 -r1.24 69c69,71 < 'keep double_vertexWeight*_*_*' --- > 'keep double_vertexWeight*_*_*', > #Jose: needed for tau embedded samples > 'keep double_generator_weight_EmbeddedRECO' cvs diff: tag enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 is not in file python/sources/DoubleMu/Run2011A_03Oct2011_v1_embedded_trans1_tau116_ptmu1_13had1_17_v1/source_cff.py cvs diff: tag enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 is not in file python/sources/DoubleMu/Run2011A_Aug05thRR_v1_embedded_trans1_tau116_ptmu1_13had1_17_v2/source_cff.py cvs diff: tag enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 is not in file python/sources/DoubleMu/Run2011A_May10thRR_v1_embedded_trans1_tau116_ptmu1_13had1_17_v1/source_cff.py cvs diff: tag enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 is not in file python/sources/DoubleMu/Run2011A_PR_v4_embedded_trans1_tau116_ptmu1_13had1_17_v1/source_cff.py cvs diff: tag enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 is not in file python/sources/DoubleMu/Run2011B_PR_v1_embedded_trans1_tau116_ptmu1_13had1_17_v2/source_cff.py Index: src/BaseJetFactory.cc =================================================================== RCS file: /cvs/CMSSW/UserCode/CMG/CMGTools/Common/src/BaseJetFactory.cc,v retrieving revision 1.10 retrieving revision 1.11 diff -r1.10 -r1.11 7a8,9 > #include <cmath> > 78c80,81 < if (fillJecUncertainty_) { --- > //there is an Exception at eta > 5.0 > if (fillJecUncertainty_ && (fabs(input->eta()) <= 5.) ){
Local differences with respect to enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 - tracking filter takes jet collection from PF2PAT - protection for JES uncertainty - additional products are kept - additional source files for embedded samples. Why do we need them? -> We should get exactly the same result as with enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11
X - cbern_CMSDataset_04Jan12 CMGTools/Production
This is the head, and we should use it.
O - cbern_rootdirstyle_01Nov11 CMGTools/RootTools O - cbern_tutorial_12Oct11 CMGTools/ZmumuJetsTutorial
X - B4_2_X_cbern_dbetaoff_04Jan12_PFPileUpSpeed CommonTools/ParticleFlow
Just speeding up PFPileUp, otherwise same as B4_2_X_cbern_dbetaoff_14Oct11 -- CommonTools/ParticleFlow
The rest is the same:
O - V110523_BE DataFormats/AnomalousEcalDataFormats O - V06-04-19-02 DataFormats/PatCandidates O - V00-11-00-01 GeneratorInterface/GenFilters O - Colin_TaggingMode_June30 JetMETAnalysis/ecalDeadCellTools O - V08-06-48 PhysicsTools/PatAlgos O - V00-03-24 PhysicsTools/SelectorUtils O - V08-02-14 PhysicsTools/UtilAlgos O - V02-04-17 RecoJets/Configuration O - V03-03-07 RecoLuminosity/LumiDB O - Colin_June23 RecoParticleFlow/PostProcessing O - V01-02-03 RecoTauTag/Configuration O - V01-02-07 RecoTauTag/RecoTau O - V01-02-00 RecoTauTag/TauTagTools O - cbern_start_18Oct11 TauAnalysis/SVFitStandAlone NoCVS UserCode/benitezj NoCVS UserCode/cbern NoCVS UserCode/palencia NoCVS UserCode/wreece --------------------------------------- total packages: 24 (24 displayed)
From Enrique: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
This list is taken from : https://savannah.cern.ch/task/index.php?24821
cbern_h2tautauvars_31Oct11 -- AnalysisDataFormats/CMGTools enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11 -- CMGTools/Common logger_cmgtools_28Nov11-17h24m21s -- CMGTools/Production cbern_rootdirstyle_01Nov11 -- CMGTools/RootTools cbern_tutorial_12Oct11 -- CMGTools/ZmumuJetsTutorial B4_2_X_cbern_dbetaoff_14Oct11 -- CommonTools/ParticleFlow V110523_BE -- DataFormats/AnomalousEcalDataFormats V06-04-19-02 -- DataFormats/PatCandidates V00-11-00-01 -- GeneratorInterface/GenFilters Colin_TaggingMode_June30 -- JetMETAnalysis/ecalDeadCellTools V08-06-48 -- PhysicsTools/PatAlgos V00-03-24 -- PhysicsTools/SelectorUtils V08-02-14 -- PhysicsTools/UtilAlgos V02-04-17 -- RecoJets/Configuration V03-03-07 -- RecoLuminosity/LumiDB Colin_June23 -- RecoParticleFlow/PostProcessing V01-02-03 -- RecoTauTag/Configuration V01-02-07 -- RecoTauTag/RecoTau V01-02-00 -- RecoTauTag/TauTagTools cbern_start_18Oct11 -- TauAnalysis/SVFitStandAlone
Conclusions ~~~~~~~~~~
"Current" is fully compatible with the version Enrique used for V2_4_0 production. In addition, it contains the following features: - Head of Production - tracking filter takes jet collection from PF2PAT - protection for JES uncertainty for eta > 5 - additional product kept (generator weight), necessary for embedded samples - additional source files for embedded samples. Why do we need them?
=> *We should get exactly the same result as with enrique_taggingFilters_07nov11*
I would propose to turn this list of tags into a V2_4_0_1 release, and to call the samples made with this release "V2_4_0_1". These samples are fully compatible with V2_4_0.
To do that, I needed to get the new release_info tools in CMGTools/Common, in addition to "Current": - getting Common/scripts - need chmod+x on this dir before building
Created the release_info file and the recipe: https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/CMS/CMGToolsReleasesExperimental#Colin_Jan_04_V2_4_0_1
Compiling on cmgtools account - ok testing interactively - ok process the DYJets Fall11 sample - jobs started process the TTJets Fall11 sample - jobs started When ready, announce to savannah.

item.note:
Begin forwarded message:
> From: Roger Wolf <roger.wolf@cern.ch> > Date: November 9, 2011 6:06:02 PM GMT+01:00 > To: Tae Jeong Kim <Tae.Jeong.Kim@cern.ch>, Colin Bernet <colin.bernet@cern.ch> > Subject: Re: new feature (adding delta-beta correction) for electron > > Hi Tae Jeong, Colin, > > I finally get to integrate the pflow deltaBeta corrections for electrons. We would like to have these developments both in 50X and 44X. Sorry TJ that I could not attend the AT meeting last week in person. From your slides I see the following recipe: > > • TJ_electron_isolation_Nov01 PhysicsTools/PatAlgos > • TJ_electron_isolation_Nov01 CommonTools/ParticleFlow > • V14-07-13 RecoParticleFlow/PFProducer > > Given that the tag of RecoParticleFlow/PFProducer, which is part of the latest IB is V14-07-07-03 the first obvious question is, whether this tag can be queued at all for 44X releases. If not Colin, TJ is it possible to have a tag with minimal changes, queued for upcoming 44 IB's and releases? > > For 44X in PatAlgos I see only two files that need to be touched: > > P plugins/PATElectronProducer.cc > P python/tools/pfTools.py > > It have set a tag V08-07-31 with those files updated to the changes that TJ did in the 44X branch. PatAlgos will then depend on CommonTools/ParticleFlow. Wrt V00-03-00 is see the following changes (*) on these files: > > P python/Isolation/pfElectronIsolation_cff.py > P python/Isolation/pfIsolatedElectrons_cfi.py > P python/Isolation/pfIsolatedPhotons_cfi.py > P python/Isolation/pfPhotonIsolation_cff.py > P python/ParticleSelectors/pfSelectedPhotons_cfi.py > > Colin, can you make an official minimal tag in 44X which includes these changes? If you have already done so can you let me know which tag to use? In 50X nothing needs to be done, while for CommonTools/ParticleFlow I think still TJ's adaptations might need to be picked up. In this case just let me know the official tag of the package that includes TJ's changes. > > Thanx a lot and cheers, > Roger > > > (*) > Index: python/Isolation/pfElectronIsolation_cff.py > =================================================================== > RCS file: /cvs/CMSSW/CMSSW/CommonTools/ParticleFlow/python/Isolation/pfElectronIsolation_cff.py,v > retrieving revision 1.2 > import * > < > < > < isoDepElectronWithCharged = isoDepositReplace( 'pfSelectedElectrons', > < 'pfAllChargedHadrons' ) > < isoDepElectronWithNeutral = isoDepositReplace( 'pfSelectedElectrons', > < 'pfAllNeutralHadrons' ) > < isoDepElectronWithPhotons = isoDepositReplace( 'pfSelectedElectrons', > < 'pfAllPhotons' ) > < # isoElectronWithElectrons = isoDepositReplace( 'pfSelectedElectrons', > < # 'pfAllElectrons' ) > < # isoElectronWithMuons = isoDepositReplace( 'pfSelectedElectrons', > < # 'pfAllMuons' ) > < > < pfElectronIsoDepositsSequence = cms.Sequence( > < isoDepElectronWithCharged + > < isoDepElectronWithNeutral + > < isoDepElectronWithPhotons > < # isoElectronWithElectrons + > < # isoElectronWithMuons > < ) > --- > > from RecoParticleFlow.PFProducer.electronPFIsolationDeposits_cff import * > > from RecoParticleFlow.PFProducer.electronPFIsolationValues_cff import * > 27,28c7,8 > < pfElectronIsoDepositsSequence + > < pfElectronIsolationFromDepositsSequence > --- > > The password will then be > renewed for 6 months. > > The persons on your site authorized to change your CC-IN2P3 account password > are : > Eric Beyer (ebeyer@in2p3.fr) > Claude Charlot (charlot@in2p3.fr) > Arnaud Chiron (chiron@in2p3.fr) > > Should you require further information, the user support team can be reached > via the web portal : > http://cctools.in2p3.fr/usersupport/ > > Thank you for your understanding. >

Re: CMST3 on EOS
item.note:
Hi Stephen,
For now, is it possible to give: - 100 Tb of quota to cmgools - 2 Tb of additional space to the major users (the ones with more than 10 Tb of used space, including myself). For example, mpierini would have 32 Tb of quota. So in total, the major users would then have about 200 Tb of quota - 1 Tb of quota to the minor users (<10 Tb of used space). In total, the minor users would have about 100 Tb of quota.
We are going to contact the major users to make sure they clean up some space.
Cheers,
Colin
On Aug 22, 2011, at 1:12 PM, Stephen J. Gowdy wrote:
> Hi Patrick & Colin, > I'm starting to prepare the area on EOS for the CMST3. One of the new features is quotas. Do we want to give cmgtools half the space as a quota (so ~210TB) and give users 2TB each? This works out about the right size although it isn't unusual to over commit quotas, assuming on average users don't fill their quotas. Or we could leave things as they are and allow users to fill it up. There are quite a few users (*) over 2TB just now though. We can either ask them to clean up or give them an increased quota. The complete list with sizes is (usually) on the TWiki (**). All those users have data outside /store/cmst3/user though. Only files under /store/cmst3/user would be copied to EOS. > > regards, > > Stephen. > > (*) > > emanuele > mpierini > cmgtools > palencia > sbologne > wreece > crovelli > cbern > pandolf > lveldere > tdahms > mnguyen > mmozer > psilva > crogan > rovere > meridian > giordano > mgouzevi > benitezj > lenzip > querten > lucieg > > (**) > > https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/viewauth/CMS/CERNCMST3#Space_usage > > -- > /------------------------------------+-------------------------\ > |Stephen J. Gowdy | CERN Office: 8-1-11| > |http://cern.ch/gowdy/ | CH-1211 Geneva 23 | > | | Switzerland | > |EMail: gowdy@cern.ch | Tel: +41 76 487 2215 | > \------------------------------------+-------------------------/
